summary: The Appalachian Trail Centennial Act aims to strengthen the preservation, maintenance, and management of national historic trails and national scenic trails, with a focus on cooperative management and public-private partnerships. The bill defines key terms, designates operational partners, outlines procedures for land protection and resource management, and clarifies the roles of federal agencies, volunteer organizations, and other stakeholders. It also addresses funding, comprehensive plans, and economic impact assessments related to these trails, with the Appalachian Trail specifically highlighted.
